attributes.action: help get Anjem Choudrey back to work so that he can contribute taxes to help support our brave soldiers who lay down their lives to uphold the democratic values of our country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Anjem Choudrey (who wanted to lead a march in Wooten Bassett to honour the dead Taliban)
receives £25,740 from the people he hates. The average British soldier /serviceman/woman
receives £17,004 from the same source.

Anjem Choudrey is an educated man so finding a job shouldn't be a problem.

Once he's back in work he can start supporting our brave soldiers who uphold the ethic of our country.

He will also be able to support his wife Rubana, his sons and daughter and the rent for his house in Leytonstone.

It was Anjem Choudrey who organised the Danish Embassy protests over the cartoons of Mohammed,
where demonstrators dressed as suicide bombers and waived banners proclaiming "Behead those who insult islam".

It was Anjem Choudrey who lauded the september 11 hijackers as "magnificent martyrs".

It was Anjem Choudrey who praised Asif Hanif who killed three in Tel Aviv.

It was Anjem Choudrey who vowed not to tell the police if he knew a terror attack was being planned.

It was Anjem Choudrey who demanded the Pope's execution.

Anjem Choudrey obviously has too much time on his hands so please vote to help him back to work.

rejection.details: We do not accept petitions about individuals.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
